intro: Saussurea susuyensis, commonly known as the Tibetan saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and large, showy composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Saussurea susuyensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional Tibetan medicine.
